Package viewcontrollers

Class AddModifyProductScreen

java.lang.Object
viewcontrollers.Controller
viewcontrollers.AddModifyController
viewcontrollers.AddModifyProductScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddModifyProductScreen extends AddModifyController implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Manages user interaction with the screens used to add and modify Products.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes this controller. Check for the presence of a Product to be modified in the selectedProduct static Product variable, and renders the associated view as the "Modify Product" screen if such data is available, pre-populating the Product's data into the appropriate text fields for editing.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onSave

      public void onSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Event handler for the save button. Either updates an existing Product or adds a new Product to Inventory, if input passes validation testing.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by interacting with the save button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • updateProduct

      public void updateProduct(Product product, Product newProduct)
      Replaces the given Product with the given newPart.
      Parameters:
      product - The Product to be replaced.
      newProduct - The replacement Product.

    • onAdd

      public void onAdd(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Event handler for the Add Part button - Adds the selected Part to this Product's associated Parts list.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event generated by interaction with this Product's Add Part button.

    • onRemove

      public void onRemove(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)

      Parameters:

    • onSearchKeyPress

      public void onSearchKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Event handler for the Part search box. Triggered when enter is pressed while the search box is selected.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The event generated by the user when a key is pressed while the search box is selected.

    • getProductFromFields

      public Product getProductFromFields()
      Validate and extract values from the current view, converting them into a Product LOGICAL ERROR: Encountered a bug where editing a part or product causes the edited object (which is, in fact, a new object) to be assigned the next ID in the appropriate object category, causing the edited item's old ID to be lost. I eventually fixed this by adding logic to the onSave method (line 69) which assigns the old ID to the replacement item before assignment to Inventory (line 86).
      Returns:
      A new Product.
